name: Aberrant Activation of Wound Healing Programs within the Metastatic Niche    Facilitates Lung Colonization by Osteosarcoma Cells
description: Lung metastasis is responsible for nearly all deaths caused by osteosarcoma, the most common pediatric bone tumor. How malignant bone cells coerce the lung microenvironment to support metastatic growth is  unclear. This study delineates how osteosarcoma cells educate the lung microenvironment during metastatic progression. Using single-cell
Study Content: 5 phenotype datasets, 19 variables, 7 samples sequenced, 5 subjects, 7 samples
Related Terms: Bone cell cancer; OSRC; OSTEOSARCOMA; Osteoblastic osteosarcoma; Osteoblastic sarcoma; Osteochondrosarcoma

name: Chromatin Landscape of BET Inhibitor-Treated CD8+ T-cells from Chronic    Lymphocytic Leukemia Patients
description: The pan-BET (bromodomain and extra-terminal) inhibitor, OPN-51107 (OPN5) was found to alleviate features of T-cell exhaustion in models of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL). To evaluate if OPN5 treatment could relieve  fixed chromatin states associated with terminal T-cell dysfunction, ATAC-sequencing was performed on CLL patient T-cells. Peripheral blood
Study Content: 3 phenotype datasets, 15 variables, 1 molecular datasets, 8 samples sequenced, 5 subjects, 10 samples
Related Terms: B Cell CLL; B Cell Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia; B Cell Leukemia, Chronic; B Cell Lymphocytic Leukemia; B Cell Malignancy, Low Grade; B Lymphocytic Leukemia, Chronic

name: Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI): Molecular Characterization    Initiative
description: The National Cancer Institute's (NCI) Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) focuses on the critical need to collect, analyze, and share data to address the burden of cancer in children, adolescents,  and young adults (AYAs). The Molecular Characterization Initiative (MCI) will further the CCDI's goals by providing access to better diagnostic tests
Study Content: 2 phenotype datasets, 5 variables, 6373 samples sequenced, 3014 subjects, 8485 samples
Related Terms: Blastoma; CA; CA - Cancer; Cancer; MT; Malignancies

name: ILyAD (Indolent Lymphoma And vitamin D)
description: Indolent non-Hodgkin lymphomas are incurable diseases, and require intermittent and often morbid and expensive therapy during their prolonged natural history. Lower intensity and better-tolerated, cost-effective treatment strategies are needed for  these patients. Low vitamin D levels at diagnosis of indolent lymphomas are strongly associated with inferior outcomes to treatment. Standard therapy
Study Content: 4 phenotype datasets, 16 variables, 1 molecular datasets, 185 samples sequenced, 185 subjects, 185 samples
Related Terms: Interdigitating cell sarcoma; Reticulosarcomas; Reticulum Cell Sarcoma; Reticulum Cell Sarcomas; Reticulum cell sarcoma morphology; Reticulum-Cell Sarcoma

name: Tumor detection by analysis of both symmetric- and hemi-methylation of    plasma cell-free DNA
description: Aberrant DNA methylation plays a critical role in tumorigenesis. While DNA methylation has been used for cancer detection and classification, DNA hemi-methylation, a novel epigenetic mark has not been analyzed  extensively in cancer epigenomes. Here we report a strand-specific (ss) sequencing method (MeDIP-Seq) for plasma cell free (cf) DNA (sscf-MeDIP-Seq),
Study Content: 3 phenotype datasets, 13 variables, 271 samples sequenced, 271 subjects, 271 samples
Study Consent: DS-HCC --- Disease-Specific (Hepatocellular Carcinoma), DS-BT --- Disease-Specific (Brain Tumors)
Related Terms: Liver Neoplasms; Brain Neoplasms; Brain Tumor; Brain Tumors; Brain neoplasm; Brain tumour

name: Identification of High-Risk PHF19 Expressing Cells in Myeloma Single-Cell    Multiomics
description: The aim of this study is to identify novel subsets of cells that are associated with progression and response to treatment. In this project, we study the tumor fraction from  49 myeloma patients across stages of progression. Samples were collected from 10 smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM), 22 newly diagnosed multiple
Study Content: 4 phenotype datasets, 30 variables, 186 samples sequenced, 49 subjects, 186 samples
Related Terms: Al amyloidosis; Cell Myeloma, Plasma; Cell Myelomas, Plasma; Disease, Kahler; Familial Myeloma; Kahler Disease

name: Genomic Characterization CS-MATCH-0007 Arm Z1B
description: The CS-MATCH-0007 protocol is part of a collaboration between the Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) and the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) to perform whole-exome sequencing and RNA  sequencing using pre-and post-treatment tumor biopsy specimens from patients enrolled on a treatment arm of the NCI-MATCH Clinical Trial (EAY131).
Related Terms: Blastoma; CA; CA - Cancer; Cancer; MT; Malignancies
